Class Media

  • java.lang.Object
    • Media
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AudioBook, Book, DVD, EBook, Magazine

    public abstract class Media
extends java.lang.Object
    Media.java - Abstract superclass for all media items.
    Author:
    Team Proxi

    • Constructor Detail

      • Media

        public Media(java.lang.String title,
             java.lang.String genre,
             java.lang.String description,
             java.lang.String year,
             boolean newRelease,
             int copies)
        Parameterized constructor for Media
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the media
        genre - The genre of the media
        description - A short description of the media
        year - A string containing the year the media was released
        newRelease - If it is a new release will be marked true, otherwise marked false
        copies - The number of identical copies a piece of media has

    • Method Detail

      • checkout

        public Media checkout()
        Checks out a piece of media
        Returns:
        The Media that was checked out

      • renew

        public void renew()
        Renews a piece of media if it hasn't already been renewed 3 times

      • returnMedia

        public void returnMedia()
        Resets renew counts and sets checked out to false. Notifies the next user on the waitlist that the item is now avaliable. TODO: May be modified later to call a user method that sets a timer to claim the hold. Modify Hold system to accomodate copies.

      • isOverdue

        public boolean isOverdue()
        Compares the current date to the last due date. If it's after, the item is overdue.
        Returns:
        true is the due date has passed.

      • addRating

        public void addRating(int rate,
                      java.lang.String comment)
        This method sets the rating of a media from 1 - 5, the user can also adds comments.
        Parameters:
        rate - The rating attached to the media
        comment - The comment to be added to the media
